evidence.text: 7 | 2025-04-15 | Emergency MOTION for Temporary Restraining Order filed by Zhuoer Chen, Mengcheng Yu, Jiarong Ouyang, Gexi Guo. (Attachments: # 1 Exhibits 1-5, # 2 Declaration of Andre Y. Bates re Notice, # 3 Declaration of Yi Yao, # 4 Declaration of Keliang (Clay) Zhu, # 5 Declaration of Zhuoer Chen, # 6 Declaration of Gexi Guo, # 7 Declaration of Mengcheng Yu, # 8 Declaration of Jiarong Ouyang, # 9 Declaration Jing Feng and Fu Von Trapp, # 10 Declaration of Richard A. Boswell, # 11 Proposed Order)(Bates, Andre) (Filed on 4/15/2025) Modified on 4/15/2025 (kmm2, COURT STAFF). (Entered: 04/15/2025)

extracted.value: Plaintiffs filed an Emergency Motion for Temporary Restraining Order on April 15, 2025, seeking an injunction against the US government/officials to vacate the APA, with a hearing set for April 21, 2025.

Plaintiffs filed a Motion for Amended Preliminary Injunction on July 30, 2025, seeking to expand the preliminary injunction to address the Department of State's visa revocations of F-1 visa holders, with the motion filed as Document 65 in the case.

evidence.source_document: Defendants' Motion for Stay Pending Appeal
Defendants' Motion for Stay Pending Appeal
evidence.text: Defendants have resolved a number of similar cases nationwide... Defendants respectfully move for a stay pending appeal of the Court's May 22, 2025, Order granting a preliminary injunction.

extracted.value: Defendants filed a Motion for Stay Pending Appeal on August 8, 2025, seeking to stay the preliminary injunction pending appeal, arguing that the injunction was an improper nationwide injunction and lacked irreparable harm.

evidence.source_document: Notice of Motion and Motion for Temporary Restraining Order; Memorandum of Law in Support of Plaintiffs' Motion for Nationwide Temporary Restraining Order
Notice of Motion and Motion for Temporary Restraining Order; Memorandum of Law in Support of Plaintiffs' Motion for Nationwide Temporary Restraining Order
evidence.text:
1. Directing Defendants to reinstate the SEVIS records and F-1 student status of Plaintiffs and all other affected F-1 students who have no record of criminal conviction and whose SEVIS records and F-1 visa status have been terminated or revoked since March 1, 2025; and
2. Prohibiting Defendants from issuing future SEVIS terminations against F-1 international students without record of criminal conviction absent notice, individualized explanation, and an opportunity to respond.

extracted.value: Plaintiffs filed a Motion for Temporary Restraining Order on April 15, 2025, seeking to reinstate SEVIS records and F-1 student status for affected students and prohibit future SEVIS terminations without due process, with the motion filed as Document 7 in the case.
